class.name: anywheresoftware.b4a.objects.drawable.StateListDrawable
class.comment: A drawable that holds other drawables and chooses the current one based on the view's state. See the <link>StateListDrawable example|http://www.basic4ppc.com/forum/basic4android-getting-started-tutorials/6589-statelistdrawable-example.html</link>.

method.name: Initialize
method.comment: Initializes the object. Example: Dim Button1 As Button Button1.Initialize("") Dim sld As StateListDrawable sld.Initiailze sld.AddState (sld.State_Disabled, DisabledDrawable) sld.AddState (sld.State_Pressed, PressedDrawable) sld.AddCatchAllState (DefaultDrawable) Button1.Background = sld

method.name: AddCatchAllState
method.comment: Adds the drawable that will be used if no other state matched the current state. This should always be the last state (states added after this one will never be used).

method.name: AddState2
method.comment: Adds a state and drawable pair. The state is made from a combination of states. You should not reuse the array specified as it is used internally by StateListDrawable. Note that the order of states is very important. The first state that matches will be used.

method.name: AddState
method.comment: Adds a state and drawable pair. Note that the order of states is very important. The first state that matches will be used.

class.name: anywheresoftware.b4a.objects.drawable.GradientDrawable
class.comment: A drawable that has a gradient color and can have round corners.

method.name: Initialize
method.comment: Initializes this object. Orientation - The gradient orientation. Can be one of the following value: "TOP_BOTTOM" "TR_BL" (Top-Right to Bottom-Left) "RIGHT_LEFT" "BR_TL" (Bottom-Right to Top-Left) "BOTTOM_TOP" "BL_TR" (Bottom-Left to Top-Right) "LEFT_RIGHT" "TL_BR" (Top-Left to Bottom-Right) Colors - An array with the gradient colors. Example: Dim Gradient1 As GradientDrawable Dim Clrs(2) As Int Clrs(0) = Colors.Black Clrs(1) = Colors.White Gradient1.Initialize("TOP_BOTTOM", Clrs)

property.name: CornerRadius
property.comment: Sets the radius of the "rectangle" corners. Set to 0 for square corners. Example: Gradient1.CornerRadius = 20dip

class.name: anywheresoftware.b4a.objects.drawable.ColorDrawable
class.comment: A drawable that has a solid color and can have round corners. Example: Dim cd As ColorDrawable cd.Initialize(Colors.Green, 5dip) Button1.Background = cd

method.name: Initialize
method.comment: Initializes the drawable with the given color and corners radius.

class.name: anywheresoftware.b4a.objects.drawable.CanvasWrapper
class.comment: A Canvas is an object that draws on other views or (mutable) bitmaps. When the canvas is initialized and set to draw on a view, a new mutable bitmap is created for that view background, the current view's background is copied to the new bitmap and the canvas is set to draw on the new bitmap. The canvas drawings are not immediately updated on the screen. You should call the target view Invalidate method to make it refresh the view. This is useful as it allows you to make several drawings and only then refresh the display. The canvas can be temporary limited to a specific region (and thus only affect this region). This is done by calling ClipPath. Removing the clipping is done by calling RemoveClip. You can get the bitmap that the canvas draws on with the Bitmap property.

method.name: DrawDrawableRotate
method.comment: Rotates and draws a Drawable into the specified rectangle. Degrees - Number of degrees to rotate (clockwise).

method.name: Initialize
method.comment: Initializes the canvas for drawing on a view. The view background will be drawn on the canvas during initialization. Note that you should not change the view's background after calling this method. Example: Dim Canvas1 As Canvas Canvas1.Initialize(Activity) 'this canvas will draw on the activity background

method.name: DrawCircle
method.comment: Draws a circle. Filled - Whether the circle will be filled. StrokeWidth - The stroke width. Relevant when Filled = False. Example: Canvas1.DrawCircle(150dip, 150dip, 20dip, Colors.Red, False, 10dip)

method.name: ClipPath
method.comment: Clips the drawing area to the given path. Example: Fills a diamond shape with gradient color. Dim Gradient1 As GradientDrawable Dim Clrs(2) As Int Clrs(0) = Colors.Black Clrs(1) = Colors.White Gradient1.Initialize("TOP_BOTTOM", Clrs) Dim Path1 As Path Path1.Initialize(50%x, 100%y) Path1.LineTo(100%x, 50%y) Path1.LineTo(50%x, 0%y) Path1.LineTo(0%x, 50%y) Path1.LineTo(50%x, 100%y) Canvas1.ClipPath(Path1) 'clip the drawing area to the path. DestRect.Left = 0%y DestRect.Top = 0%y DestRect.Right = 100%x DestRect.Bottom = 100%y Canvas1.DrawDrawable(Gradient1, DestRect) 'fill the drawing area with the gradient. Activity.Invalidate

method.name: MeasureStringHeight
method.comment: Returns the height of the given text. Example of drawing a blue text with white rectangle as the background: Dim Rect1 As Rect Dim width, height As Float Dim t As String t = "Text to write" width = Canvas1.MeasureStringWidth(t, Typeface.DEFAULT, 14) height = Canvas1.MeasureStringHeight(t, Typeface.DEFAULT, 14) Rect1.Initialize(100dip, 100dip, 100dip + width, 100dip + height) Canvas1.DrawRect(Rect1, Colors.White, True, 0) Canvas1.DrawText(t, Rect1.Left, Rect1.Bottom, Typeface.DEFAULT, 14, Colors.Blue, "LEFT")

method.name: DrawLine
method.comment: Draws a line from (x1, y1) to (x2, y2). StrokeWidth determines the width of the line. Example: Canvas1.DrawLine(100dip, 100dip, 200dip, 200dip, Colors.Red, 10dip) Activity.Invalidate

method.name: DrawBitmapRotated
method.comment: Rotates the bitmap and draws it. SrcRect - The subset of the bitmap that will be drawn. If Null then the complete bitmap will be drawn. DestRect - The rectangle that the bitmap will be drawn to. Degrees - Number of degrees to rotate the bitmap (clockwise). Example: Canvas1.DrawBitmapRotated(Bitmap1, Null, DestRect, 70)

method.name: DrawColor
method.comment: Fills the entire canvas with the given color. Example: Canvas1.DrawColor(Colors.ARGB(100, 255, 0, 0)) 'fills with semi-transparent red color. Activity.Invalidate

method.name: DrawOval
method.comment: Draws an oval shape. Filled - Whether the rectangle will be filled. StrokeWidth - The stroke width. Relevant when Filled = False. Example: Dim Rect1 As Rect Rect1.Initialize(100dip, 100dip, 200dip, 150dip) Canvas1.DrawOval(Rect1, Colors.Gray, False, 5dip) Activity.Invalidate

method.name: DrawRect
method.comment: Draws a rectangle. Filled - Whether the rectangle will be filled. StrokeWidth - The stroke width. Relevant when Filled = False. Example: Dim Rect1 As Rect Rect1.Initialize(100dip, 100dip, 200dip, 150dip) Canvas1.DrawRect(Rect1, Colors.Gray, False, 5dip) Activity.Invalidate

method.name: DrawBitmap
method.comment: Draws a bitmap. SrcRect - The subset of the bitmap that will be drawn. If Null then the complete bitmap will be drawn. DestRect - The rectangle that the bitmap will be drawn to. Example: Dim Bitmap1 As Bitmap Bitmap1.Initialize(File.DirAssets, "X.jpg") Dim DestRect As Rect DestRect.Initialize(10dip, 10dip, 10dip + 100dip, 10dip + 100dip) Canvas1.DrawBitmap(Bitmap1, Null, DestRect) 'draws the bitmap to the destination rectangle. Dim SrcRect As Rect SrcRect.Initialize(0, 0, Bitmap1.Width / 2, Bitmap1.Height) 'the left half of the bitmap. DestRect.Top = 200dip DestRect.Bottom = 200dip + 100dip Canvas1.DrawBitmap(Bitmap1, SrcRect, DestRect) 'draws half of the bitmap. Activity.Invalidate

method.name: DrawTextRotated
method.comment: Rotates the text and draws it. Text - The text to be drawn. x, y - The origin point. Typeface1 - Typeface (font) to use. TextSize - This value will be automatically scaled so do not scale it yourself. Color - Text color. Align - The alignment related to the origin. One of the following values: "LEFT", "CENTER", "RIGHT". Degrees - Number of degrees to rotate (clockwise). Example: Canvas1.DrawTextRotated("This is a nice sentence.", 200dip, 200dip, _ Typeface.DEFAULT_BOLD, 30, Colors.Blue, "CENTER", -45)

method.name: DrawPath
method.comment: Draws the path. Filled - Whether the path will be filled. StrokeWidth - The stroke width. Relevant when Filled = False. Example: Dim Path1 As Path Path1.Initialize(50%x, 100%y) Path1.LineTo(100%x, 50%y) Path1.LineTo(50%x, 0%y) Path1.LineTo(0%x, 50%y) Path1.LineTo(50%x, 100%y) Canvas1.DrawPath(Path1, Colors.Magenta, False, 10dip)

method.name: DrawOvalRotated
method.comment: Rotates the oval and draws it. Filled - Whether the rectangle will be filled. StrokeWidth - The stroke width. Relevant when Filled = False. Degrees - Number of degrees to rotate the oval (clockwise).

method.name: MeasureStringWidth
method.comment: Returns the width of the given text. Example of drawing a blue text with white rectangle as the background: Dim Rect1 As Rect Dim width, height As Float Dim t As String t = "Text to write" width = Canvas1.MeasureStringWidth(t, Typeface.DEFAULT, 14) height = Canvas1.MeasureStringHeight(t, Typeface.DEFAULT, 14) Rect1.Initialize(100dip, 100dip, 100dip + width, 100dip + height) Canvas1.DrawRect(Rect1, Colors.White, True, 0) Canvas1.DrawText(t, Rect1.Left, Rect1.Bottom, Typeface.DEFAULT, 14, Colors.Blue, "LEFT")

method.name: DrawPoint
method.comment: Draws a point at the specified position and color. Example: Canvas1.DrawPoint(50%x, 50%y, Colors.Yellow) 'draws a point in the middle of the screen.

method.name: DrawBitmapFlipped
method.comment: Flips the bitmap and draws it. SrcRect - The subset of the bitmap that will be drawn. If Null then the complete bitmap will be drawn. DestRect - The rectangle that the bitmap will be drawn to. Vertically - Whether to flip the bitmap vertically. Horizontally - Whether to flip the bitmap horizontally. Example: Canvas1.DrawBitmapFlipped(Bitmap1, Null, DestRect, False, True)

method.name: DrawDrawable
method.comment: Draws a Drawable into the specified rectangle. Example: Dim Gradient1 As GradientDrawable Dim Clrs(2) As Int Clrs(0) = Colors.Green Clrs(1) = Colors.Blue Gradient1.Initialize("TOP_BOTTOM", Clrs) Canvas1.DrawDrawable(Gradient1, DestRect) Activity.Invalidate

method.name: DrawRectRotated
method.comment: Rotates the rectangle and draws it. Filled - Whether the rectangle will be filled. StrokeWidth - The stroke width. Relevant when Filled = False. Degrees - Number of degrees to rotate the rectangle (clockwise).

method.name: RemoveClip
method.comment: Removes previous clipped region.

method.name: DrawText
method.comment: Draws the text. Text - The text to be drawn. x, y - The origin point. Typeface1 - Typeface (font) to use. TextSize - This value will be automatically scaled so do not scale it yourself. Color - Text color. Align - The alignment related to the origin. One of the following values: "LEFT", "CENTER", "RIGHT". Example: Canvas1.DrawText("This is a nice sentence.", 200dip, 200dip, Typeface.DEFAULT_BOLD, 30, Colors.Blue, "LEFT")

method.name: Initialize2
method.comment: Initializes the canvas for drawing on this bitmap. The bitmap must be mutable. Bitmaps created from files or input streams are NOT mutable.

property.name: Bitmap
property.comment: Returns the bitmap that the canvas draws to. Example: Saves the drawing to a file Dim Out As OutputStream Out = File.OpenOutput(File.DirRootExternal, "Test.png", False) Canvas1.Bitmap.WriteToStream(out, 100, "PNG") Out.Close

class.name: anywheresoftware.b4a.objects.drawable.CanvasWrapper.BitmapWrapper
class.comment: An object that holds a bitmap image. The bitmap can be loaded from a file or other input stream, or can be set from a different bitmap. Loading large bitmaps can easily lead to out of memory exceptions. This is true even if the file is compressed and not large as the bitmap is stored uncompressed in memory. For large images you can call InitializeSample and load a subsample of the image. The whole image will be loaded with a lower resolution.

method.name: Initialize
method.comment: Initializes the bitmap from the given file. Note that the image will be downsampled if there is not enough memory available. Example: Dim Bitmap1 As Bitmap Bitmap1.Initialize(File.DirAssets, "X.jpg")

method.name: InitializeMutable
method.comment: Creates a new mutable bitmap with the specified dimensions. You can use a Canvas object to draw on this bitmap.

method.name: WriteToStream
method.comment: Writes the bitmap to the output stream. Quality - Value between 0 (smaller size, lower quality) to 100 (larger size, higher quality), which is a hint for the compressor for the required quality. Format - JPEG or PNG. Example: Dim Out As OutputStream Out = File.OpenOutput(File.DirRootExternal, "Test.png", False) Bitmap1.WriteToStream(out, 100, "PNG") Out.Close

method.name: GetPixel
method.comment: Returns the color of the pixel at the specified position.

method.name: Initialize2
method.comment: Initializes the bitmap from the given stream.

method.name: Initialize3
method.comment: Initializes the bitmap with a copy of the original image (copying is done if necessary).

method.name: InitializeSample
method.comment: Initializes the bitmap from the given file. The decoder will subsample the bitmap if MaxWidth or MaxHeight are smaller than the bitmap dimensions. This can save a lot of memory when loading large images. Note that the actual dimensions may be larger than the specified values.

property.name: Height
property.comment: Returns the bitmap height.

property.name: Width
property.comment: Returns the bitmap width.

class.name: anywheresoftware.b4a.objects.drawable.CanvasWrapper.RectWrapper
class.comment: Holds four coordinates which represent a rectangle.

property.name: CenterX
property.comment: Returns the horizontal center.

property.name: CenterY
property.comment: Returns the vertical center.

class.name: anywheresoftware.b4a.objects.drawable.CanvasWrapper.PathWrapper
class.comment: A path is a collection of points that represent a connected path. The first point is set when it is initialized, and then other points are added with LineTo.

method.name: Initialize
method.comment: Initializes the path and sets the value of the first point.

method.name: LineTo
method.comment: Adds a line from the last point to the specified point.

class.name: anywheresoftware.b4a.objects.drawable.BitmapDrawable
class.comment: A drawable that draws a bitmap. The bitmap is set during initialization. You can change the way the bitmap appears by changing the Gravity property. Example: Dim bd As BitmapDrawable bd.Initialize(LoadBitmap(File.DirAssets, "SomeImage.png")) bd.Gravity = Gravity.FILL Activity.Background = bd

property.name: Bitmap
property.comment: Returns the internal Bitmap.

property.name: Gravity
property.comment: Gets or sets the gravity value. This value affects the way the image will be drawn. Example: BitmapDrawable1.Gravity = Gravity.FILL

class.name: anywheresoftware.b4a.keywords.StringBuilderWrapper
class.comment: StringBuilder is a mutable string, unlike regular strings which are immutable. StringBuilder is especially useful when you need to concatenate many strings. The following code demonstrates the performance boosting of StringBuilder: Dim start As Long start = DateTime.Now 'Regular string Dim s As String For i = 1 To 5000 s = s & i Next Log(DateTime.Now - start) 'StringBuilder start = DateTime.Now Dim sb As StringBuilder sb.Initialize For i = 1 To 5000 sb.Append(i) Next Log(DateTime.Now - start) Tested on a real device, the first 'for loop' took about 20 seconds and the second took less then tenth of a second. The reason is that the code: s = s & i creates a new string each iteration (strings are immutable). The method StringBuilder.ToString converts the object to a string.

method.name: Initialize
method.comment: Initializes the object. Example: Dim sb As StringBuilder sb.Initialize sb.Append("The value is: ").Append(SomeOtherVariable).Append(CRLF)

method.name: Insert
method.comment: Inserts the specified text at the specified offset.

method.name: Append
method.comment: Appends the specified text at the end. Returns the same object, so you can chain methods. Example: sb.Append("First line").Append(CRLF).Append("Second line")

method.name: ToString
method.comment: Converts the object to a string.

method.name: Remove
method.comment: Removes the specified characters. StartOffset - The first character to remove. EndOffset - The ending index. This character will not be removed.

property.name: Length
property.comment: Returns the number of characters.

class.name: anywheresoftware.b4a.keywords.Regex
class.comment: Regex is a predefined object that contains regular expressions methods. All methods receive a 'pattern' string. This is the regular expression pattern. More information about the regular expression engine can be found here: <link>Pattern Javadoc|http://docs.oracle.com/javase/7/docs/api/java/util/regex/Pattern.html</link> <link>Regular expression in Basic4android tutorial|http://www.basic4ppc.com/forum/basic4android-getting-started-tutorials/7123-regular-expressions-tutorial.html</link>.

method.name: IsMatch2
method.comment: Tests whether the given text is a match for the given pattern. Options - One or more pattern options. These options can be combined with Bit.Or.

method.name: Split
method.comment: Splits the given text around matches of the pattern. Example: Dim components() As String components = Regex.Split(",", "abc,def,,ghi") 'returns: "abc", "def", "", "ghi"

method.name: Matcher2
method.comment: Same as Matcher with the additional pattern options.

method.name: IsMatch
method.comment: Tests whether the given text is a match for the given pattern. The whole text should match the pattern. Use Matcher if you look for a substring that matches the pattern. Example: If Regex.IsMatch("\d\d\d", EditText1.Text) = False Then ...

method.name: Split2
method.comment: Same as Split with the additional pattern options.

method.name: Matcher
method.comment: Returns a Matcher object which can be used to find matches of the given pattern in the text. Example: Dim text, pattern As String text = "This is an interesting sentence with two numbers: 123456 and 7890." pattern = "\d+" 'one or more digits Dim Matcher1 As Matcher Matcher1 = Regex.Matcher(pattern, text) Do While Matcher1.Find Log("Found: " & Matcher1.Match) Loop

field.name: MULTILINE
field.comment: Changes ^ and $ to match the start and end of each line instead of the whole string.

field.name: CASE_INSENSITIVE
field.comment: Enables case insensitive matching.

class.name: anywheresoftware.b4a.keywords.Regex.MatcherWrapper
class.comment: A Matcher object is used to search for a pattern in a string. Regex.Matcher returns a matcher object for a specific pattern and specific text. Example: Dim text, pattern As String text = "This is an interesting sentence with two numbers: 123456 and 7890." pattern = "\d+" 'one or more digits Dim Matcher1 As Matcher Matcher1 = Regex.Matcher(pattern, text) Do While Matcher1.Find Log("Found: " & Matcher1.Match) Loop

method.name: GetStart
method.comment: Returns the start offset of the specified captured group. Use GetStart(0) to get the start offset of the whole match.

method.name: Find
method.comment: Searches for the next substring that matches the pattern. Returns True if such a match was found. Example: Dim text, pattern As String text = "This is an interesting sentence with two numbers: 123456 and 7890." pattern = "\d+" 'one or more digits Dim Matcher1 As Matcher Matcher1 = Regex.Matcher(pattern, text) Do While Matcher1.Find Log("Found: " & Matcher1.Match) Loop

method.name: Group
method.comment: Returns the value of the specified captured group. Group(0) returns the whole match.

method.name: GetEnd
method.comment: Returns the end offset of the specified captured group. Use GetEnd(0) to get the end offset of the whole match.

property.name: GroupCount
property.comment: Returns the number of capturing groups in the pattern. Note that the number returned does not include group(0) which is the whole match.

property.name: Match
property.comment: Returns the matched value. This is the same as calling Group(0).

class.name: anywheresoftware.b4a.keywords.LayoutValues
class.comment: Holds values related to the display. You can get the values of the the current display by calling GetDeviceLayoutValues. For example: Dim lv As LayoutValues lv = GetDeviceLayoutValues Log(lv) 'will print the values to the log Activity.LoadLayout and Panel.LoadLayout return a LayoutValues object with the values of the chosen layout variant.

property.name: ApproximateScreenSize
property.comment: Returns the approximate screen size.

field.name: Height
field.comment: The display height (pixels).

field.name: Width
field.comment: The display width (pixels).

field.name: Scale
field.comment: The device scale value which is equal to 'dots per inch' / 160.

class.name: anywheresoftware.b4a.keywords.DateTime
class.comment: Date and time related methods. DateTime is a predefined object. You should not declare it yourself. Date and time values are stored as ticks. Ticks are the number of milliseconds since January 1, 1970 00:00:00 UTC. This value is too large to be stored in an Int variable. It should only be stored in a Long variable. The methods DateTime.Date and DateTime.Time convert the ticks value to a string. You can get the current time with DateTime.Now. Example: Dim now As Long now = DateTime.Now Msgbox("The date is: " & DateTime.Date(now) & CRLF & _ "The time is: " & DateTime.Time(now), "")

method.name: GetYear
method.comment: Returns the year component from the ticks value.

method.name: GetMinute
method.comment: Returns the minutes within a hour component from the ticks value. Values are between 0 to 59.

method.name: GetHour
method.comment: Returns the hour of day component from the ticks value. Values are between 0 to 23.

method.name: DateTimeParse
method.comment: Parses the given date and time strings and returns the ticks representation.

method.name: ListenToExternalTimeChanges
method.comment: Creates a dynamic broadcast receiver that listens to the "time-zone changed" event and "time set" event. By calling this method the time-zone will update automatically when the device time-zone changes. DateTime_TimeChanged event will be raised when the time-zone changes or when the time is set.

method.name: DateParse
method.comment: Parses the given date string and returns its ticks representation. An exception will be thrown if parsing fails. Example: Dim SomeTime As Long SomeTime = DateTime.DateParse("02/23/2007")

method.name: Time
method.comment: Returns a string representation of the time (which is stored as ticks). The time format can be set with the TimeFormat keyword. Example: Log("The time now is: " & DateTime.Time(DateTime.Now))

method.name: GetTimeZoneOffsetAt
method.comment: Returns the offset measured in hours from UTC at the specified date (offset can change due to daylight saving settings).

method.name: Date
method.comment: Returns a string representation of the date (which is stored as ticks). The date format can be set with the DateFormat keyword. Example: Log("Today is: " & DateTime.Date(DateTime.Now))

method.name: GetSecond
method.comment: Returns the seconds within a minute component from the ticks value. Values are between 0 to 59.

method.name: SetTimeZone
method.comment: Sets the application time zone. This setting affect the conversions of dates to ticks value and vice versa (device default settings are not changed).

method.name: GetDayOfWeek
method.comment: Returns the day of week component from the ticks value. Values are between 1 to 7, where 1 means Sunday. You can use the AHLocale library if you need to change the first day.

method.name: GetDayOfYear
method.comment: Returns the day of year component from the ticks value. Values are between 1 to 366.

method.name: Add
method.comment: Returns a ticks value which is the result of adding the specified time spans to the given ticks value. Pass negative values if you want to subtract the values. Example: Dim Tomorrow As Long Tomorrow = DateTime.Add(DateTime.Now, 0, 0, 1) Log("Tomorrow date is: " & DateTime.Date(Tomorrow))

method.name: TimeParse
method.comment: Parses the given time string and returns its ticks representation. Note that the returned value date will be today.

method.name: GetMonth
method.comment: Returns the month of year component from the ticks value. Values are between 1 to 12.

method.name: GetDayOfMonth
method.comment: Returns the day of month component from the ticks value. Values are between 1 to 31.

property.name: DateFormat
property.comment: Gets or sets the format used to parse date strings. See this page for the supported patterns: <link>formats|http://docs.oracle.com/javase/7/docs/api/java/text/SimpleDateFormat.html</link>. The default pattern is MM/dd/yyyy (04/23/2002 for example).

property.name: DeviceDefaultDateFormat
property.comment: Returns the default date format based on the device selected language.

property.name: DeviceDefaultTimeFormat
property.comment: Returns the default time format based on the device selected language.

property.name: Now
property.comment: Gets the current time as ticks (number of milliseconds since January 1, 1970).

property.name: TimeZoneOffset
property.comment: Returns the current offset measured in hours from UTC.

property.name: TimeFormat
property.comment: Gets or sets the format used to parse time strings. See this page for the supported patterns: <link>formats|http://docs.oracle.com/javase/7/docs/api/java/text/SimpleDateFormat.html</link>. The default pattern is HH:mm:ss (23:45:12 for example).

class.name: anywheresoftware.b4a.keywords.Common
class.comment: These are the internal keywords.

method.name: ACos
method.comment: Returns the angle measured with radians.

method.name: ATan2D
method.comment: Returns the angle measured with degrees.

method.name: Exit
method.comment: Exits the most inner loop. Note that Exit inside a Select block will exit the Select block.

method.name: NumberFormat2
method.comment: Converts the specified number to a string. The string will include at least Minimum Integers, at most Maximum Fractions digits and at least Minimum Fractions digits. GroupingUsed - Determines whether to group every three integers. Example: Log(NumberFormat2(12345.67, 0, 3, 3, false)) '"12345.670"

method.name: Try
method.comment: Any exception thrown inside a try block will be caught in the catch block. Call LastException to get the caught exception. Syntax: Try ... Catch ... End Try

method.name: Chr
method.comment: Returns the character that is represented by the given unicode value.

method.name: Rnd
method.comment: Returns a random integer between Min (inclusive) and Max (exclusive).

method.name: PerXToCurrent
method.comment:
Returns the actual size of the given percentage of the activity width. Example: Button1.Width = PerXToCurrent(50) 'Button1.Width = 50% * Activity.Width
A shorthand syntax for this method is available. Any number followed by the string '%x' will be converted in the same manner (no spaces are allowed between the number and '%x'). So the previous code is equivalent to: Button1.Width = 50%x

method.name: InputList
method.comment: Shows a modal dialog with a list of items and radio buttons. Pressing on an item will close the dialog. Returns the index of the selected item or DialogResponse.Cancel if the user pressed on the back key. List - Items to display. Title - Dialog title. CheckedItem - The index of the item that will first be selected. Pass -1 if no item should be preselected.

method.name: Array
method.comment: Creates a single dimension array of the specified type. The syntax is: Array [As type] (list of values). If the type is ommitted then an array of objects will be created. Example: Dim Days() As String Days = Array As String("Sunday", "Monday", ...)

method.name: GetDeviceLayoutValues
method.comment: Returns the device LayoutValues. Example: Log(GetDeviceLayoutValues)

method.name: SubExists
method.comment: Tests whether the object includes the specified method. Returns false if the object was not initialized or not an instance of a user class.

method.name: ASin
method.comment: Returns the angle measured with radians.

method.name: CallSubNew3
method.comment: Similar to CallSub. Calls a sub with two arguments.

method.name: CallSubNew2
method.comment: Similar to CallSub. Calls a sub with a single argument.

method.name: DipToCurrent
method.comment:
Scales the value, which represents a specific length on a default density device (Density = 1.0), to the current device. For example, the following code will set the width value of this button to be the same physical size on all devices. Button1.Width = DipToCurrent(100)
Note that a shorthand syntax for this method is available. Any number followed by the string 'dip' will be converted in the same manner (no spaces are allowed between the number and 'dip'). So the previous code is equivalent to: Button1.Width = 100dip 'dip -> density independent pixel

method.name: ATan2
method.comment: Returns the angle measured with radians.

method.name: While
method.comment: Loops while the condition is true. Syntax: Do While condition ... Loop

method.name: Min
method.comment: Returns the smaller number between the two numbers.

method.name: ConfigureHomeWidget
method.comment: Creates a RemoteViews object based on the layout file. The compiler will generate the required XML files based on the parameters. See the widgets tutorial for more information: <link>Widgets tutorial|http://www.basic4ppc.com/forum/basic4android-getting-started-tutorials/10166-android-home-screen-widgets-tutorial-part-i.html</link>. Note that all parameters must be strings or numbers as they are read by the compiler. LayoutFile - The widget layout file. EventName - Sets the subs that will handle the RemoteViews events. UpdateIntervalMinutes - Sets the update interval. Pass 0 to disable automatic updates. Minimum value is 30 (or 0). WidgetName - The name of the widget as appears in the widgets list. CenterWidget - Whether to center the widget.

method.name: StartServiceAtExact
method.comment: Same as StartServiceAt for Android versions up to 4.3 (API 18). On Android 4.4+ it forces the OS to start the service at the exact time. This method will have a larger impact on the battery compared to StartServiceAt.

method.name: InputMap
method.comment: Shows a modal dialog with a list of items and checkboxes. The user can select multiple items. The dialog is closed by pressing on the "Ok" button. The items displayed are the map keys. Items with a value of True will be checked. When the user checks or unchecks an item, the related item value gets updated. Items - A map object with the items as keys and their checked state as values. Example: Dim m As Map m.Initialize m.Put("Item #1", True) m.Put("Item #2", False) m.Put("Item #3", False) m.Put("Item #4", True) InputMap(m, "Check items")

method.name: ATanD
method.comment: Returns the angle measured with degrees.

method.name: ProgressDialogShow2
method.comment: Shows a dialog with a circular spinning bar and the specified text. Unlike Msgbox and InputList methods, the code will not block. You should call ProgressDialogHide to remove the dialog. Cancelable - Whether the user can dismiss the dialog by pressing on the Back key.

method.name: Power
method.comment: Returns the Base value raised to the Exponent power.

method.name: Dim
method.comment: Declares a variable. Syntax: Declare a single variable: Dim variable name [As type] [= expression] The default type is String. Declare multiple variables. All variables will be of the specified type. Dim [Const] variable1 [= expression], variable2 [= expression], ..., [As type] Note that the shorthand syntax only applies to Dim keyword. Example:Dim a = 1, b = 2, c = 3 As Int Declare an array: Dim variable(Rank1, Rank2, ...) [As type] Example:Dim Days(7) As String The actual rank can be omitted for zero length arrays.

method.name: NumberFormat
method.comment: Converts the specified number to a string. The string will include at least Minimum Integers and at most Maximum Fractions digits. Example: Log(NumberFormat(12345.6789, 0, 2)) '"12,345.68" Log(NumberFormat(1, 3 ,0)) '"001"

method.name: StartService
method.comment: Starts the given service. The service will be first created if it was not started before. The target service will be started once the program is free to process its message queue. Note that you cannot show a Msgbox after this call and before the service starts. Service - The service module or the service name. Example: StartService(SQLService)

method.name: Floor
method.comment: Returns the largest double that is smaller or equal to the specified number and is equal to an integer.

method.name: ProgressDialogShow
method.comment: Shows a dialog with a circular spinning bar and the specified text. Unlike Msgbox and InputList methods, the code will not block. You should call ProgressDialogHide to remove the dialog. The dialog will also be removed if the user presses on the Back key.

method.name: Me
method.comment: For classes: returns a reference to the current instance. For activities and services: returns a reference to an object that can be used with CallSub, CallSubDelayed and SubExists keywords. Cannot be used in code modules.

method.name: SmartStringFormatter
method.comment: Internal keyword used by the Smart String literal.

method.name: InputMultiList
method.comment: Shows a modal dialog with a list of items and checkboxes. The user can select multiple items. The dialog is closed by pressing on the "Ok" button. Returns a list with the indices of the selected items. The list is sorted. Returns an empty list if the user has pressed on the back key.

method.name: Select
method.comment: Compares a single value to multiple values. Example: Dim value As Int value = 7 Select value Case 1 Log("One") Case 2, 4, 6, 8 Log("Even") Case 3, 5, 7, 9 Log("Odd larger than one") Case Else Log("Larger than 9") End Select

method.name: CallSubNew
method.comment: Calls the given sub. CallSub can be used to call a sub which belongs to a different module. However the sub will only be called if the other module is not paused. In that case an empty string will be returned. You can use IsPaused to test whether a module is paused. This means that one activity cannot call a sub of a different activity. As the other activity will be paused for sure. CallSub allows an activity to call a service sub or a service to call an activity sub. Note that it is not possible to call subs of code modules. CallSub can also be used to call subs in the current module. Pass an empty string as the component in that case. Example: CallSub(Main, "RefreshData")

method.name: Return
method.comment: Returns from the current sub and optionally returns the given value. Syntax: Return [value]

method.name: RndSeed
method.comment: Sets the random seed value. This method can be used for debugging as it allows you to get the same results each time.

method.name: If
method.comment: Single line: If condition Then true-statement [Else false-statement] Multiline: If condition Then statement Else If condition Then statement ... Else statement End If

method.name: DoEvents
method.comment: Processes waiting messages in the messages queue. DoEvents can be called inside lengthy loops to allow the program to update its UI. Other waiting events will not be handled by DoEvents.

method.name: CallSubDelayed
method.comment: CallSubDelayed is a combination of StartActivity, StartService and CallSub. Unlike CallSub which only works with currently running components, CallSubDelayed will first start the target component if needed. CallSubDelayed can also be used to call subs in the current module. Instead of calling these subs directly, a message will be sent to the message queue. The sub will be called when the message is processed. This is useful in cases where you want to do something "right after" the current sub (usually related to UI events). Note that if you call an Activity while the whole application is in the background (no visible activities), the sub will be executed once the target activity is resumed.

method.name: ASinD
method.comment: Returns the angle measured with degrees.

method.name: ExitApplication
method.comment: Immediately ends the application and stops the process. Most applications should not use this method and prefer Activity.Finish which lets the OS decide when the process is killed.

method.name: PerYToCurrent
method.comment:
Returns the actual size of the given percentage of the activity height. Example: Button1.Height = PerYToCurrent(50) 'Button1.Height = 50% * Activity.Height
A shorthand syntax for this method is available. Any number followed by the string '%y' will be converted in the same manner (no spaces are allowed between the number and '%y'). So the previous code is equivalent to: Button1.Height = 50%y

method.name: Round2
method.comment: Rounds the given number and leaves up to the specified number of fractional digits.

method.name: CharsToString
method.comment: Creates a new String by copying the characters from the array. Copying starts from StartOffset and the number of characters copied equals to Length.

method.name: ACosD
method.comment: Returns the angle measured with degrees.

method.name: LoadBitmapSample
method.comment: Loads the bitmap. The decoder will subsample the bitmap if MaxWidth or MaxHeight are smaller than the bitmap dimensions. This can save a lot of memory when loading large images. Example: Activity.SetBackgroundImage(LoadBitmapSample(File.DirAssets, "SomeFile.jpg", Activity.Width, Activity.Height))

method.name: Type
method.comment: Declares a structure. Can only be used inside sub Globals or sub Process_Globals. Syntax: Type type-name (field1, field2, ...) Fields include name and type. Example: Type MyType (Name As String, Items(10) As Int) Dim a, b As MyType a.Initialize a.Items(2) = 123

method.name: IsBackgroundTaskRunning
method.comment: Tests whether a background task, submitted by the container object and with the specified id, is running.

method.name: Abs
method.comment: Returns the absolute value.

method.name: Continue
method.comment: Stops executing the current iteration and continues with the next one.

method.name: Catch
method.comment: Any exception thrown inside a try block will be caught in the catch block. Call LastException to get the caught exception. Syntax: Try ... Catch ... End Try

method.name: IsPaused
method.comment: Tests whether the given component is paused. Will also return true for components that were not started yet. Example: If IsPaused(Main) = False Then CallSub(Main, "RefreshData")

method.name: GetType
method.comment: Returns a string representing the object's java type.

method.name: Is
method.comment: Tests whether the object is of the given type. Example: For i = 0 To Activity.NumberOfViews - 1 If Activity.GetView(i) Is Button Then Dim b As Button b = Activity.GetView(i) b.Color = Colors.Blue End If Next

method.name: ATan
method.comment: Returns the angle measured with radians.

method.name: Sender
method.comment: Returns the object that raised the event. Only valid while inside the event sub. Example: Sub Button_Click Dim b As Button b = Sender b.Text = "I've been clicked" End Sub

method.name: Log
method.comment: Logs a message. The log can be viewed in the Logs tab.

method.name: SinD
method.comment: Calculates the trigonometric sine function. Angle measured in degrees.

method.name: ProgressDialogHide
method.comment: Hides a visible progress dialog. Does not do anything if no progress dialog is visible.

method.name: Max
method.comment: Returns the larger number between the two numbers.

method.name: For
method.comment: Syntax: For variable = value1 To value2 [Step interval] ... Next If the iterator variable was not declared before it will be of type Int. Or: For Each variable As type In collection ... Next Examples: For i = 1 To 10 Log(i) 'Will print 1 to 10 (inclusive). Next For Each n As Int In Numbers 'an array Sum = Sum + n Next Note that the loop limits will only be calculated once before the first iteration.

method.name: Msgbox
method.comment: Shows a modal message box with the specified message and title. The dialog will show one OK button. Note that services cannot show modal dialogs. Example: Msgbox("Hello world", "This is the title")

method.name: Sub
method.comment: Declares a sub with the parameters and return type. Syntax: Sub name [(list of parameters)] [As return-type] Parameters include name and type. The lengths of arrays dimensions should not be included. Example: Sub MySub (FirstName As String, LastName As String, Age As Int, OtherValues() As Double) As Boolean ... End Sub In this example OtherValues is a single dimension array. The return type declaration is different than other declarations as the array parenthesis follow the type and not the name (which does not exist in this case).

method.name: CancelScheduledService
method.comment: Cancels previously scheduled tasks for this service.

method.name: IsDevTool
method.comment: Returns true if ToolName equals B4A.

method.name: CallSubDelayed3
method.comment: Similar to CallSubDelayed. Calls a sub with two arguments.

method.name: StartActivity
method.comment: Starts an activity or brings it to front if it already exists. The target activity will be started once the program is free to process its message queue. Activity can be a string with the target activity name or it can be the actual activity. After this call the current activity will be paused and the target activity will be resumed. This method can also be used to send Intents objects to the system. Note that you should usually not call StartActivity from a Service. Example: StartActivity (Activity2)

method.name: Sqrt
method.comment: Returns the positive square root.

method.name: CallSubDelayed2
method.comment: Similar to CallSubDelayed. Calls a sub with a single argument.

method.name: Asc
method.comment: Returns the unicode code point of the given character or first character in string.

method.name: StopService
method.comment: Stops the given service. Service_Destroy will be called. Call StartService afterwards will first create the service. Service - The service module or service name. Pass empty string to stop the current service (from the service module). Example: StopService(SQLService)

method.name: LoadBitmap
method.comment: Loads the bitmap. Note that the Android file system is case sensitive. You should consider using LoadBitmapSample if the image size is large. The actual file size is not relevant as images are usually stored compressed. Example: Activity.SetBackgroundImage(LoadBitmap(File.DirAssets, "SomeFile.jpg"))

method.name: Tan
method.comment: Calculates the trigonometric tangent function. Angle measured in radians.

method.name: ToastMessageShow
method.comment: Shows a quick little message that goes out automatically. Message - The text message to show. LongDuration - If true then shows the message for a long period, otherwise shows the message for a short period.

method.name: CosD
method.comment: Calculates the trigonometric cosine function. Angle measured in degrees.

method.name: Msgbox2
method.comment: Shows a modal message box with the specified message and title. Message - The dialog message. Title - The dialog title. Positive - The text to show for the "positive" button. Pass "" if you don't want to show the button. Cancel - The text to show for the "cancel" button. Pass "" if you don't want to show the button. Negative - The text to show for the "negative" button. Pass "" if you don't want to show the button. Icon - A bitmap that will be drawn near the title. Pass Null if you don't want to show an icon. Returns one of the DialogResponse values. Example: Dim result As Int result = Msgbox2("This is the message", "This is the title", "Good", "", "Bad", LoadBitmap(File.DirAssets, "smiley.gif")) If result = DialogResponse.Positive Then ...

method.name: TanD
method.comment: Calculates the trigonometric tangent function. Angle measured in degrees.

method.name: Round
method.comment: Returns the closest long number to the given number.

method.name: LogColor
method.comment: Logs a message. The message will be displayed in the IDE with the specified color.

method.name: StartServiceAt
method.comment: Schedules the given service to start at the given time. Service - The service module or service name. Pass an empty string when calling from a service module that schedules itself. Time - The time to start the service. If this time has already past the service will be started now. DuringSleep - Whether to start the service when the device is sleeping. If set to false and the device is sleeping at the specified time, the service will be started when the device wakes up. StartServiceAt can be used to schedule a repeating task. You should call it under Service_Start to schedule the next task. This call cancels previous scheduled tasks (for the same service). Example: StartServiceAt(SQLService, DateTime.Now + 30 * 1000, false) 'will start after 30 seconds.

method.name: Not
method.comment: Inverts the value of the given boolean.

method.name: Sin
method.comment: Calculates the trigonometric sine function. Angle measured in radians.

method.name: Ceil
method.comment: Returns the smallest double that is greater or equal to the specified number and is equal to an integer.

method.name: Cos
method.comment: Calculates the trigonometric cosine function. Angle measured in radians.

method.name: LastException
method.comment: Returns the last exception that was caught (if such exists).

method.name: IsNumber
method.comment: Tests whether the specified string can be safely parsed as a number.

method.name: CreateMap
method.comment: Creates a Map with the given key / value pairs. The syntax is: CreateMap (key1: value1, key2: value2, ...) Example: Dim m As Map = CreateMap("January": 1, "February": 2)

method.name: Until
method.comment: Loops until the condition is true. Syntax: Do Until condition ... Loop

method.name: BytesToString
method.comment: Decodes the given bytes array as a string. Data - The bytes array. StartOffset - The first byte to read. Length - Number of bytes to read. CharSet - The name of the character set. Example: Dim s As String s = BytesToString(Buffer, 0, Buffer.Length, "UTF-8")

field.name: QUOTE
field.comment: Quote character. The value of Chr(34).

field.name: Gravity
field.comment: Gravity constants.

field.name: Density
field.comment: Returns the device scale, which is DPI / 160. (DPI stands for dots per inch).

field.name: File
field.comment: Files related methods.

field.name: cPI
field.comment: PI constant.

field.name: KeyCodes
field.comment: Key codes constants.

field.name: CRLF
field.comment: New line character. The value of Chr(10).

field.name: Colors
field.comment: Colors related methods and constants.

field.name: TAB
field.comment: Tab character.

field.name: DateTime
field.comment: Date and time related methods.

field.name: Typeface
field.comment: Typeface related methods.

field.name: Application
field.comment: Application related properties.

field.name: Bit
field.comment: Bitwise related methods.

field.name: DialogResponse
field.comment: Dialogs related constants.

field.name: cE
field.comment: e (natural logarithm base) constant.

field.name: Regex
field.comment: Regular expressions related methods.

class.name: anywheresoftware.b4a.keywords.Bit
class.comment: Bit is a predefined object containing bitwise related methods. Example: Dim flags As Int flags = Bit.Or(100, 200)

method.name: InputStreamToBytes
method.comment: Reads the data from the input stream and writes it into an array of bytes. The input stream is automatically closed at the end.

method.name: ToHexString
method.comment: Returns a string representation of N in base 16.

method.name: UnsignedShiftRight
method.comment: Shifts N right. Shifts zeroes in the leftmost positions. Shift - Number of positions to shift.

method.name: ToBinaryString
method.comment: Returns a string representation of N in base 2.

method.name: Or
method.comment: Returns the bitwise OR of the two values.

method.name: ParseInt
method.comment: Parses Value as an integer using the specified radix. Radix - Should be between 2 to 36.

method.name: ToOctalString
method.comment: Returns a string representation of N in base 8.

method.name: Xor
method.comment: Returns the bitwise XOR of the two values.

method.name: ShiftLeft
method.comment: Shifts N left. Shift - Number of positions to shift.

method.name: ShiftRight
method.comment: Shifts N right. Keeps the original value sign Shift - Number of positions to shift.

method.name: And
method.comment: Returns the bitwise AND of the two values.

method.name: Not
method.comment: Returns the bitwise complement of the given value.

property.name: PackageName
property.comment: Returns the application package name.

property.name: VersionCode
property.comment: Returns the application version code (VersionCode attribute).

property.name: LabelName
property.comment: Returns the application name (ApplicationLabel attribute).

property.name: VersionName
property.comment: Returns the application version name (VersionName attribute).

class.name: anywheresoftware.b4a.keywords.constants.TypefaceWrapper
class.comment: Typeface is a predefined object that holds the typeface styles and the default installed fonts. Note that unlike most other predefined objects, you can declare new objects of this type. Example: EditText1.Typeface = Typeface.DEFAULT_BOLD

method.name: CreateNew
method.comment: Returns a typeface with the specified style. Example: Typeface.CreateNew(Typeface.MONOSPACE, Typeface.STYLE_ITALIC)

method.name: LoadFromAssets
method.comment: Loads a font file, that was added with the file manager. Example: Dim MyFont As Typeface MyFont = Typeface.LoadFromAssets("MyFont.ttf") EditText1.Typeface = MyFont

class.name: anywheresoftware.b4a.keywords.constants.KeyCodes
class.comment: A predefined object with the key codes constants. These constants are passed to Activity KeyPressed event for example.

class.name: anywheresoftware.b4a.keywords.constants.Gravity
class.comment: Predefined object containing "gravity" values. These values affect the alignment of text or images. Example: Dim EditText1 As EditText EditText1.Initialize("") EditText1.Gravity = Gravity.CENTER

class.name: anywheresoftware.b4a.keywords.constants.DialogResponse
class.comment: A predefined object containing the possible values that dialogs return. For example: Dim result As Int result = Msgbox2("Save changes?", "", "Yes", "", "No", Null) If result = DialogResponse.POSITIVE Then 'save changes End If

class.name: anywheresoftware.b4a.keywords.constants.Colors
class.comment: A predefined object containing color constants. For example: Activity.Color = Colors.Green

method.name: ARGB
method.comment: Returns an integer value representing the color built from the three components and with the specified alpha value. Each component should be a value between 0 to 255 (inclusive) Alpha - A value between 0 to 255 where 0 is fully transparent and 255 is fully opaque.

method.name: RGB
method.comment: Returns an integer value representing the color built from the three components. Each component should be a value between 0 to 255 (inclusive) Alpha is implicitly set to 255 (opaque).

class.name: anywheresoftware.b4a.objects.collections.Map
class.comment: A collection that holds pairs of keys and values. The keys are unique. Which means that if you add a key/value pair (entry) and the collection already holds an entry with the same key, the previous entry will be removed from the map. Fetching an item is done by looking for its key. This is usually a very fast operation (O(1) compared to O(n) in a list). The key should be a string or a number. The value can be any type of object. Note that this map implementation does return items in the same order as they were added. Usually you will use Put to add items and Get or GetDefault to get the values based on the key. If you need to iterate over all the items you can use a For loop like: For i = 0 To Map1.Size - 1 Dim Key, Value As String Key = Map1.GetKeyAt(i) Value = Map1.GetValueAt(i) Next Similar to a list, a map can hold any object, however if it is a process global variable then it cannot hold activity objects (like views). Maps are very useful for storing applications settings. You can save and load maps with File.WriteMap and File.ReadMap.

method.name: Initialize
method.comment: Initializes the object. Example: Dim Map1 As Map Map1.Initialize

method.name: Values
method.comment: Returns an object which can be used to iterate over all the values with a For Each block. Example: For Each v As Int In map1.Values Log(v) Next

method.name: Put
method.comment: Puts a key/value pair in the map, overwriting the previous item with this key (if such exists). Returns the previous item with this key or null if there was no such item. Note that if you are using strings as the keys then the keys are case sensitive. Example: Map1.Put("Key", "Value")

method.name: GetDefault
method.comment: Returns the value of the item with the given key. If no such item exists the specified default value is returned.

method.name: GetValueAt
method.comment: Returns the value of the item at the given index. GetKeyAt and GetValueAt should be used to iterate over all the items. These methods are optimized for iterating over the items in ascending order. Example: For i = 0 to Map.Size - 1 Log("Key: " & Map.GetKeyAt(i)) Log("Value: " & Map.GetValueAt(i)) Next

method.name: Clear
method.comment: Clears all items from the map.

method.name: Keys
method.comment: Returns an object which can be used to iterate over all the keys with a For Each block. Example: For Each k As String In map1.Keys Log(k) Next

method.name: ContainsKey
method.comment: Tests whether there is an item with the given key. Example: If Map.ContainsKey("some key") Then ...

method.name: Remove
method.comment: Removes the item with the given key, if such exists. Returns the item removed or null if no matching item was found.

method.name: Get
method.comment: Returns the value of the item with the given key.

method.name: GetKeyAt
method.comment: Returns the key of the item at the given index. GetKeyAt and GetValueAt should be used to iterate over all the items. These methods are optimized for iterating over the items in ascending order. Example: For i = 0 to Map.Size - 1 Log("Key: " & Map.GetKeyAt(i)) Log("Value: " & Map.GetValueAt(i)) Next

property.name: Size
property.comment: Returns the number of items stored in the map.

class.name: anywheresoftware.b4a.objects.collections.List
class.comment: Lists are similar to dynamic arrays. You can add and remove items from a list and it will change its size accordingly. A list can hold any type of object. However if a list is declared as a process global object it cannot hold activity objects (like views). Basic4android automatically converts regular arrays to lists. So when a List parameter is expected you can pass an array instead. For example: Dim List1 As List List1.Initialize List1.AddAll(Array As Int(1, 2, 3, 4, 5)) Use the Get method to get an item from the list. Lists can be saved and loaded from files using File.WriteList and File.ReadList. You can use a For loop to iterate over all the values: For i = 0 To List1.Size - 1 Dim number As Int number = List1.Get(i) ... Next

method.name: Initialize
method.comment: Initializes an empty list.

method.name: Sort
method.comment: Sorts the list. The items must all be numbers or strings.

method.name: IndexOf
method.comment: Returns the index of the specified item, or -1 if it was not found.

method.name: Clear
method.comment: Removes all the items from the list.

method.name: AddAll
method.comment: Adds all elements in the specified collection to the end of the list. Note that you can add an array directly. Example: List.AddAll(Array As String("value1", "value2"))

method.name: SortCaseInsensitive
method.comment: Lexicographically sorts the list, ignoring the characters case. The items must all be numbers or strings.

method.name: SortTypeCaseInsensitive
method.comment: Similar to SortType. Lexicographically sorts the list, ignoring the characters case.

method.name: SortType
method.comment: Sorts a list with items of user defined type. The list is sorted based on the specified field. FieldName - The case-sensitive field name that will be used for sorting. Field must contain numbers or strings. Ascending - Whether to sort ascending or descending. Example: Sub Process_Globals Type Person(Name As String, Age As Int) End Sub Sub Activity_Create(FirstTime As Boolean) Dim Persons As List Persons.Initialize For i = 1 To 50 Dim p As Person p.Name = "Person" & i p.Age = Rnd(0, 121) Persons.Add(p) Next Persons.SortType("Age", True) 'Sort the list based on the Age field. For i = 0 To Persons.Size - 1 Dim p As Person p = Persons.Get(i) Log(p) Next End Sub

method.name: RemoveAt
method.comment: Removes the item at the specified index.

method.name: Add
method.comment: Adds an item at the end of the list.

method.name: Get
method.comment: Gets the item in the specified index. The item is not removed from the list.

method.name: Set
method.comment: Replaces the current item in the specified index with the new item.

method.name: Initialize2
method.comment: Initializes a list with the given values. This method should be used to convert arrays to lists. Note that if you pass a list to this method then both objects will share the same list, and if you pass an array the list will be of a fixed size. Meaning that you cannot later add or remove items. Example: Dim List1 As List List1.Initialize2(Array As Int(1,2,3,4,5)) Example: Dim List1 As List Dim SomeArray(10) As String 'Fill array... List1.Initialize2(SomeArray)

method.name: InsertAt
method.comment: Inserts the specified element in the specified index, before the current item at that index. As a result all items with index equal to or larger than the specified index are shifted.

method.name: AddAllAt
method.comment: Adds all elements in the specified collection starting at the specified index.

property.name: Size
property.comment: Returns the number of items in the list.

class.name: anywheresoftware.b4a.objects.WebViewWrapper
class.comment: The WebView view uses the internal WebKit engine to display Html pages. The page displayed can be an online page loaded with LoadUrl or a Html string loaded with LoadHtml. The PageFinished event is raised after the page loads. OverrideUrl is called before loading any Url. If this method returns True then the Url will not be loaded. You can use this event as a way to handle click events in your code. UserAndPasswordRequired event is raised when accessing a site that requires basic authentication. You should return an array of strings with the username as the first element and password as the second element. For example:Return Array As String("someuser", "password123") Returning Null will cancel the request. Sending incorrect credentials will cause this event to be raised again.
class.event: UserAndPasswordRequired (Host As String, Realm As String) As String()

method.name: LoadUrl
method.comment: Loads the given Url. Example: WebView1.LoadUrl("http://www.google.com")

method.name: BringToFront
method.comment: Changes the Z order of this view and brings it to the front.

method.name: RequestFocus
method.comment: Tries to set the focus to this view. Returns True if the focus was set.

method.name: RemoveView
method.comment: Removes this view from its parent.

method.name: Forward
method.comment: Goes forward to the next Url.

method.name: Back
method.comment: Goes back to the previous Url.

method.name: Invalidate3
method.comment: Invalidates the given rectangle. Redrawing will only happen when the program can process messages. Usually when it finishes running the current code.

method.name: Invalidate2
method.comment: Invalidates the given rectangle. Redrawing will only happen when the program can process messages. Usually when it finishes running the current code.

method.name: Initialize
method.comment: Initializes the view and sets the subs that will handle the events. Views added with the designer should NOT be initialized. These views are initialized when the layout is loaded.

method.name: Zoom
method.comment: Zooms in or out according to the value of In. Returns true if zoom has changed.

method.name: StopLoading
method.comment: Stops the current load.

method.name: LoadHtml

class.name: anywheresoftware.b4a.objects.Timer
class.comment: A Timer object generates ticks events at specified intervals. Using a timer is a good alternative to a long loop, as it allows the UI thread to handle other events and messages. Note that the timer events will not fire while the UI thread is busy running other code. The timer Enabled property is set to False by default. To make it start working you should change it to True. Timer events will not fire when the activity is paused, or if a blocking dialog (like Msgbox) is visible. Timers should be declared in Sub Process_Globals. Otherwise you may get multiple timers running when the activity is recreated. It is also important to disable the timer when the activity is pausing and then enable it when it resumes. This will save CPU and battery.

method.name: Initialize
method.comment: Initializes the timer with the event sub prefix and the specified interval (measured in milliseconds). IMPORTANT: this object should be declared in Sub Process_Globals. Example: Timer1.Initialize("Timer1", 1000) Timer1.Enabled = True Sub Timer1_Tick 'Handle tick events End Sub

property.name: Enabled
property.comment: Gets or sets whether the timer is enabled (ticking).

property.name: Interval
property.comment: Gets or sets the interval between tick events, measured in milliseconds.

class.name: anywheresoftware.b4a.objects.String2
class.comment: Strings are immutable in Basic4android, which means that you can change the value of a string variable but you cannot change the text stored in a string object. So methods like SubString, Trim and ToLowerCase return a new string, they do not change the value of the current string. Typical usage: Dim s As String s = "some text" s = s.Replace("a", "b") You can use StringBuilder if you need a mutable string. Note that string literals are also string objects: Log(" some text ".Trim)

method.name: substring
method.comment: Returns a new string which is a substring of the original string. The new string will include the character at BeginIndex and will extend to the character at EndIndex, not including the last character. Example: "012345".SubString2(2, 4) 'returns "23"

method.name: indexOf
method.comment: Returns the index of the first occurrence of SearchFor string in the string. Starts searching from the given Index. Returns -1 if SearchFor was not found.

method.name: trim
method.comment: Returns a copy of the original string without any leading or trailing white spaces.

method.name: startsWith
method.comment: Returns true if this string starts with the given Prefix.

method.name: indexOf
method.comment: Returns the index of the first occurrence of SearchFor string in the string. Returns -1 if SearchFor was not found.

method.name: contains
method.comment: Tests whether the string contains the given string parameter.

method.name: getBytes
method.comment: Encodes the string into a new array of bytes. Example: Dim Data() As Byte Data = "Some string".GetBytes("UTF8")

method.name: replace
method.comment: Returns a new string resulting from the replacement of all the occurrences of Target with Replacement.

method.name: endsWith
method.comment: Returns true if this string ends with the given Suffix.

method.name: toUpperCase
method.comment: Returns a new string which is the result of upper casing this string.

method.name: substring
method.comment: Returns a new string which is a substring of the original string. The new string will include the character at BeginIndex and will extend to the end of the string. Example: "012345".SubString(2) 'returns "2345"

method.name: compareTo
method.comment: Lexicographically compares the two strings. Returns a value less than 0 if the current string precedes Other. Returns 0 if both strings are equal. Returns a value larger than 0 if the current string comes after Other. Note that upper case characters precede lower case characters. Examples: "abc".CompareTo("da") ' < 0 "abc".CompareTo("Abc") ' > 0 "abc".CompareTo("abca")' < 0

method.name: charAt
method.comment: Returns the character at the given index.

method.name: length
method.comment: Returns the length of this string.

method.name: lastIndexOf
method.comment: Returns the index of the first occurrence of SearchFor string in the string. The search starts at the end of the string and advances to the beginning.

method.name: equalsIgnoreCase
method.comment: Returns true if both strings are equal ignoring their case.

method.name: toLowerCase
method.comment: Returns a new string which is the result of lower casing this string.

method.name: lastIndexOf
method.comment: Returns the index of the first occurrence of SearchFor string in the string. The search starts at the given index and advances to the beginning.

method.name: Invalidate
method.comment: Invalidates the whole view forcing the view to redraw itself. Redrawing will only happen when the program can process messages. Usually when it finishes running the current code.

method.name: SetLayout

method.name: RemoveViewAt
method.comment: Removes the view that is stored in the specified index.

method.name: AddView

method.name: SetColorAnimated

Note that the animation will only be applied when running on Android 3+ devices. Duration - Animation duration measured in milliseconds.

method.name: SetLayoutAnimated
method.comment: Similar to SetLayout. Animates the change. Note that the animation will only be applied when running on Android 3+ devices. Duration - Animation duration measured in milliseconds.

method.name: LoadLayout

method.name: SetVisibleAnimated
method.comment: Changes the view visibility with a fade-in or fade-out animation. Note that the animation will only be applied when running on Android 3+ devices. Duration - Animation duration measured in milliseconds. Visible - New visibility state.

class.name: anywheresoftware.b4a.objects.NotificationWrapper
class.comment: A status bar notification. The user can open the notifications screen and press on the notification. Pressing on the notification will start an activity as set by the notification object. Notifications are usually used by services as services are not expected to directly start activities. The notification must have an icon and its "info" must be set. Example: Dim n As Notification n.Initialize n.Icon = "icon" n.SetInfo("This is the title", "and this is the body.", Main) 'Change Main to "" if this code is in the main module. n.Notify(1)

method.name: Initialize
method.comment: Initializes the notification. By default the notification plays a sound, shows a light and vibrates the phone.

method.name: SetInfo2
method.comment: Similar to SetInfo. Also sets a string that can be later extracted in Activity_Resume. Title - The message title. Body - The message body. Tag - An arbitrary string that can be later extract when the user clicks on the notification. Activity - The activity to start when the user presses on the notification. Pass an empty string to start the current activity (when calling from an activity module). Example of extracting the tag: Sub Activity_Resume Dim in As Intent in = Activity.GetStartingIntent If in.HasExtra("Notification_Tag") Then Log(in.GetExtra("Notification_Tag")) 'Will log the tag End If End Sub

method.name: SetInfo
method.comment: Sets the message text and action. Title - The message title. Body - The message body. Activity - The activity to start when the user presses on the notification. Pass an empty string to start the current activity (when calling from an activity module). Example: n.SetInfo("Some title", "Some text", Main)

method.name: Cancel
method.comment: Cancels the notification with the given Id.

method.name: Notify
method.comment: Displays the notification. Id - The notification id. This id can be used to later update this notification (by calling Notify again with the same Id), or to cancel the notification.

property.name: Insistent
property.comment: Sets whether the sound will play repeatedly until the user opens the notifications screen.

property.name: Number
property.comment: Gets or sets a number that will be displayed on the icon. This is useful to represent multiple events in a single notification.

property.name: OnGoingEvent
property.comment: Sets whether this notification is an "ongoing event". The notification will be displayed in the ongoing section and it will not be cleared.

property.name: Sound
property.comment: Sets whether the notification will play a sound. Example: n.Sound = False

property.name: AutoCancel
property.comment: Sets whether the notification will be canceled automatically when the user clicks on it.

property.name: Light
property.comment: Sets whether the notification will show a light. Example: n.Light = False

property.name: Vibrate
property.comment: Sets whether the notification will vibrate. Example: n.Vibrate = False

property.name: Icon
property.comment: Sets the icon displayed. The icon value is the name of the image file without the extension. The name is case sensitive. The image file should be manually copied to the following folder: source folder\Objects\res\drawable. You can use "icon" to use the application icon (which is also located in this folder): n.Icon = "icon"

class.name: anywheresoftware.b4a.objects.MediaPlayerWrapper
class.comment: The MediaPlayer can be used to play audio files. See the media player tutorial|http://www.basic4ppc.com/forum/basic4android-getting-started-tutorials/6591-mediaplayer-tutorial.html for more information. NOTE: The media player should be declared as a process global object. The Complete event is raised when playback completes. It will only be raised if you initialize the object with Initialize2.

method.name: Release
method.comment: Releases all resources allocated by the media player.

method.name: Initialize
method.comment: Initializes the object. You should use Initialize2 if you want to handle the Complete event. Example: Dim MP As MediaPlayer 'should be done in Sub Process_Globals MP.Initialize2("MP") MP.Load(File.DirAssets, "SomeFile.mp3") MP.Play

method.name: IsPlaying
method.comment: Returns true if the media player is currently playing.

method.name: SetVolume
method.comment: Sets the playing volume for each channel. The value should be between 0 to 1.

method.name: Play
method.comment: Starts (or resumes) playing the loaded audio file.

method.name: Load
method.comment: Loads an audio file and prepares it for playing.

method.name: Pause
method.comment: Pauses playback. You can resume playback from the current position by calling Play.

method.name: Initialize2
method.comment: Similar to Initialize2. Complete event will be raised when play back completes. EventName - The Sub that will handle the Complete event.

method.name: Stop
method.comment: Stops playing. You must call Load before trying to play again.

property.name: Duration
property.comment: Returns the total duration of the loaded file (in milliseconds).

property.name: Position
property.comment: Gets or sets the current position (in milliseconds).

property.name: Looping
property.comment: Gets or sets whether the media player will restart playing automatically.

class.name: anywheresoftware.b4a.objects.ListViewWrapper
class.comment: ListView is a very useful view that can handle large and small lists. The ListView raises two events. ItemClick is raised when an item is clicked and ItemLongClick is raised when an item is clicked and held. See the <link>ListView tutorial|http://www.basic4ppc.com/forum/basic4android-getting-started-tutorials/6537-listview-tutorial.html</link> for more information.
class.event: ItemClick (Position As Int, Value As Object)
ItemLongClick (Position As Int, Value As Object)

class.name: anywheresoftware.b4a.objects.IntentWrapper
class.comment: Intent objects are messages which you can send to the OS in order to do some external action. The Intent object should be sent with StartActivity keyword. See this page|http://developer.android.com/intl/fr/reference/android/content/Intent.html for a list of standard constants. Example, launch YouTube application: Dim Intent1 As Intent Intent1.Initialize(Intent1.ACTION_MAIN, "") Intent1.SetComponent("com.google.android.youtube/.HomeActivity") StartActivity(Intent1)

method.name: Initialize
method.comment: Initializes the object using the given Action and data Uri. Action can be one of the action constants or any other string. Pass an empty string if a Uri is not required.

method.name: SetComponent
method.comment: Explicitly sets the component that will handle this intent.

method.name: ExtrasToString
method.comment: Returns a string containing the extra items. This is useful for debugging.

method.name: AddCategory
method.comment: Adds a category describing the intent required operation.

method.name: SetType
method.comment: Sets the MIME type. Example: Intent1.SetType("text/plain")

method.name: GetData
method.comment: Retrieves the data component as a string.

method.name: PutExtra
method.comment: Adds extra data to the intent.

method.name: GetExtra
method.comment: Returns the item value with the given key.

method.name: WrapAsIntentChooser
method.comment: Wraps the intent in another "chooser" intent. A dialog will be displayed to the user with the available services that can act on the intent. WrapAsIntentChooser should be the last method called before sending the intent.

method.name: HasExtra
method.comment: Tests whether an item with the given key exists.

method.name: Initialize2
method.comment: Initializes the object by parsing the Uri. Flags - Additional integer value. Pass 0 if it is not required. Example: Dim Intent1 As Intent Intent1.Initialize2("http://www.basic4ppc.com", 0) StartActivity(Intent1)

property.name: Action
property.comment: Gets or sets the Intent action.

property.name: Flags
property.comment: Gets or sets the flags component.

The HorizontalScrollView has an inner panel which actually contains the child views. You can add views by calling: HorizontalScrollView1.Panel.AddView(...) Note that it is not possible to nest scrolling views.

class.name: anywheresoftware.b4a.objects.EditTextWrapper
class.comment: EditText view is a view that allows the user to write free text (similar to WinForms TextBox). The EditText has two modes; SingleLine and MultiLine. You can set it to be multiline by calling EditText1.SingleLine = False On most devices the soft keyboard will show automatically when the user presses on the EditText. You can change the InputType property and change the type of keyboard that appears. For example: EditText1.InputType = EditText1.INPUT_TYPE_NUMBERS will cause the numeric keyboard to appear when the user presses on the EditText. Note that it will also cause the EditText to only accept numbers. The TextChanged event fires whenever the text changes and it includes the old and new strings. The EnterPressed event fires when the user presses on the enter key or action key (Done or Next). The FocusChanged event fires when the view is focused or loses focus. HasFocus parameter value will be set accordingly. Note that most views are not focusable. For example, pressing on a Button will not change the focus state of an EditText.

class.name: anywheresoftware.b4a.objects.ConcreteViewWrapper
class.comment: View is a special type of object. You cannot create new View objects. However all other view types can be assigned to a view variable. This allows you to access the shared properties of all views. class.name: anywheresoftware.b4a.objects.AutoCompleteEditTextWrapper
class.comment: An enhanced version of EditText which shows the user a drop down list with all items matching the currently entered characters. Items matching are items starting with the current input or items that include a word that starts with the current input (words must be separated with spaces). Call SetItems with the list of possible items. ItemClick event is raised when the user clicks on an item from the list. Example: Sub Process_Globals End Sub Sub Globals Dim ACT As AutoCompleteEditText End Sub Sub Activity_Create(FirstTime As Boolean) ACT.Initialize("ACT") Activity.AddView(ACT, 10dip, 10dip, 500dip, 80dip) Dim countries() As String countries = Array As String( _ "Afghanistan", "Albania", "Algeria", "American Samoa", "Andorra", _ "Angola", "Anguilla", "Antarctica", "Antigua and Barbuda",
