class.name: anywheresoftware.b4a.objects.ActivityWrapper
class.comment: Each activity module include a predefined Activity object. Activity is the main component of your application. Activities have three special life cycle related event: Activity_Create, Activity_Resume and Activity_Pause. See this tutorial for more information about activities and processes life cycle: Life cycle tutorial|http://www.basic4ppc.com/forum/basic4android-getting-started-tutorials/6487-android-process-activities-life-cycle.html. You can add and remove views to this activity with AddView and RemoveViewAt methods. You can also load a layout file with LoadLayout. The Touch event can be used to handle user touches. The first parameter of this event is the Action parameter. The parameter values can be ACTION_DOWN, ACTION_MOVE or ACTION_UP. Use this value to find the user current action. The KeyPress and KeyUp events occur when the user presses or releases a key, assuming that no other view has consumed this event (like EditText). When handling the KeyPress or KeyUp event you should return a boolean value which tells whether the event was consumed. For example if the user pressed on the Back key and you return True then the OS will not close your activity. Sub Activity_KeyPress (KeyCode As Int) As Boolean If Keycode = KeyCodes.KEYCODE_BACK Then Return True Else Return False End If End Sub You can add menu items to the activity with AddMenuItem method. Note that this method should only be called inside Activity_Create event. Starting from Android 4.3 it is not possible to show a modal dialog inside the KeyPress or KeyUp events, with one exception which is in the case of the Back key. If you need to show a modal dialog for other keys then you should call a sub with CallSubDelayed and show the modal dialog in that sub.
class.event: Touch (Action As Int, X As Float, Y As Float)
KeyPress (KeyCode As Int) As Boolean 'Return True to consume the event

method.name: RequestFocus
method.comment: Tries to set the focus to this view. Returns True if the focus was set.

method.name: GetView
method.comment: Gets the view that is stored in the specified index.

method.name: OpenMenu
method.comment: Programmatically opens the menu.

method.name: Finish
method.comment: Closes this activity.

method.name: SetActivityResult
method.comment: (Advanced) Sets the result that the calling Activity will get after calling StartActivityForResult.

method.name: GetStartingIntent
method.comment: (Advanced) Gets the intent object that started this Activity. This can be used together with SetActivityResult to return results to 3rd party applications.

method.name: AddMenuItem2
method.comment: Adds a menu item to the activity. Title - Menu item title. EventName - The prefix name of the sub that will handle the click event. Bitmap - Bitmap to draw as the item background. Only the first five (or six if there are six total) menu items display icons. This method should only be called inside sub Activity_Create. Note that the 'Sender' value inside the click event equals to the clicked menu item text. Example: Activity.AddMenuItem2("Open File", "OpenFile", LoadBitmap(File.DirAssets, "SomeImage.png")) ... Sub OpenFile_Click ... End Sub

method.name: Invalidate3
method.comment: Invalidates the given rectangle. Redrawing will only happen when the program can process messages. Usually when it finishes running the current code.

method.name: Invalidate2
method.comment: Invalidates the given rectangle. Redrawing will only happen when the program can process messages. Usually when it finishes running the current code.

method.name: Initialize
method.comment: Initializes the view and sets the subs that will handle the events. Views added with the designer should NOT be initialized. These views are initialized when the layout is loaded.

method.name: RerunDesignerScript
method.comment: This method is deprecated. It ignores the anchoring features and it will fail in Rapid Debug mode. You should instead remove the views and load the layout again.

method.name: RemoveAllViews
method.comment: Removes all child views.

method.name: GetAllViewsRecursive
method.comment: Returns an iterator that iterates over all the child views including views that were added to other child views. Example: For Each v As View In Activity.GetAllViewsRecursive ... Next

method.name: DisableAccessibility
method.comment: This method was added as a workaround for the following <link>Android bug|https://code.google.com/p/android/issues/detail?id=55933</link>. By setting the Disable property to True the child views (of all Activities) will not be added to the accessibility enabled list.

method.name: AddMenuItem3
method.comment: Similar to AddMenuItem2. If AddToActionBar is true then the item will be displayed in the action bar (on Android 3.0+ devices) if there is enough room. If there is not enough room then the item will be displayed together with the other menu items.

method.name: AddMenuItem
method.comment: Adds a menu item to the activity. Title - Menu item title. EventName - The prefix name of the sub that will handle the click event. This method should only be called inside sub Activity_Create. Note that the 'Sender' value inside the click event equals to the clicked menu item text. Example: Activity.AddMenuItem("Open File", "OpenFile") ... Sub OpenFile_Click ... End Sub

method.name: SetLayout
method.comment: Changes the view position and size.

method.name: Invalidate
method.comment: Invalidates the whole view forcing the view to redraw itself. Redrawing will only happen when the program can process messages. Usually when it finishes running the current code.

method.name: RemoveViewAt
method.comment: Removes the view that is stored in the specified index.

method.name: SetColorAnimated
method.comment: Changes the background color with a transition animation between the FromColor and the ToColor colors. The transition is based on the HSV color space. Note that the animation will only be applied when running on Android 3+ devices. Duration - Animation duration measured in milliseconds.

method.name: AddView
method.comment: Adds a view to this activity.

method.name: SetLayoutAnimated
method.comment: Similar to SetLayout. Animates the change. Note that the animation will only be applied when running on Android 3+ devices. Duration - Animation duration measured in milliseconds.

method.name: CloseMenu
method.comment: Programmatically closes the menu.

method.name: SetVisibleAnimated
method.comment: Changes the view visibility with a fade-in or fade-out animation. Note that the animation will only be applied when running on Android 3+ devices. Duration - Animation duration measured in milliseconds. Visible - New visibility state.

method.name: LoadLayout
method.comment: Loads a layout file (.bal). Returns the LayoutValues of the actual layout variant that was loaded.

property.name: TitleColor
property.comment: Gets or sets the title color. This property is only supported by Android 2.x devices. It will not do anything on newer devices.

property.name: Height
property.comment: Gets or sets the view's height.

property.name: Background
property.comment: Gets or sets the background drawable.

property.name: NumberOfViews
property.comment: Returns the number of child views.

property.name: Color
property.comment: Sets the background of the view to be a ColorDrawable with the given color. If the current background is of type GradientDrawable or ColorDrawable the round corners will be kept.

property.name: Tag
property.comment: Gets or sets the Tag value. This is a place holder which can used to store additional data.

property.name: Width
property.comment: Gets or sets the view's width.

class.name: anywheresoftware.b4a.objects.streams.File
class.comment: File is a predefined object that holds methods for working with files. The <link>Text files tutorial|http://www.basic4ppc.com/forum/basic4android-getting-started-tutorials/6690-text-files.html</link> covers most of the File methods and concepts.

method.name: GetText
method.comment: Reads the entire file and returns its text. The file is assumed to be encoded with UTF8.

method.name: WriteMap
method.comment: Creates a new file and writes the given map. Each key value pair is written as a single line. All values are converted to strings. See this link for more information about the actual format: <link>Properties format|http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/.properties</link>. You can use File.ReadMap to read this file.

method.name: OpenOutput
method.comment: Opens (or creates) the specified file which is located in the Dir folder for writing. If Append is true then the new data will be written at the end of the existing file.

method.name: ListFiles
method.comment: Returns a read only list with all the files and directories which are stored in the specified path. An uninitialized list will be returned if the folder is not accessible.

method.name: Combine
method.comment: Returns the full path to the given file. This methods does not support files in the assets folder.

method.name: OpenInput
method.comment: Opens the specified file name which is located in the Dir folder for reading. Note that the Android file system is case sensitive.

method.name: Copy
method.comment: Copies the specified source file to the target file name. Note that it is not possible to copy files to the Assets folder.

method.name: Copy2
method.comment: Copies all the available data from the input stream into the output stream. The input stream is automatically closed at the end.

method.name: ReadMap
method.comment: Reads the file and parses each line as a key-value pair (of strings). See this link for more information about the actual format: <link>Properties format|http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/.properties</link>. You can use File.WriteMap to write a map to a file. Note that the order of items in the map may not be the same as the order in the file.

method.name: IsDirectory
method.comment: Tests whether the specified file is a directory.

method.name: ReadList
method.comment: Reads the entire file and returns a List with all lines (as strings). Example: Dim List1 As List List1 = File.ReadList(File.DirDefaultExternal, "1.txt") For i = 0 to List1.Size - 1 Log(List1.Get(i)) Next

method.name: WriteList
method.comment: Writes each item in the list as a single line. Note that a value containing CRLF will be saved as two lines (which will return two item when read with ReadList). All values will be converted to strings. Example: File.WriteList (File.DirInternal, "mylist.txt", List1)

method.name: Exists
method.comment: Returns true if the specified FileName exists in the specified Dir. Note that the Android file system is case sensitive. Example: If File.Exists(File.DirDefaultExternal, "MyFile.txt") Then ...

method.name: ReadString
method.comment: Reads the file and returns its content as a string. Example: Dim text As String text = File.ReadString(File.DirRootExternal, "1.txt")

method.name: Delete
method.comment: Deletes the specified file. If the file name is a directory then it must be empty in order to be deleted. Returns true if the file was successfully deleted. Files in the assets folder cannot be deleted.

method.name: MakeDir
method.comment: Creates the given folder (creates all folders as needed). Example: File.MakeDir(File.DirInternal, "music/90")

method.name: LastModified
method.comment: Returns the last modified date of the specified file. This method does not support files in the assets folder. Example: Dim d As Long d = File.LastModified(File.DirRootExternal, "1.txt") Msgbox(DateTime.Date(d), "Last modified")

method.name: WriteString
method.comment: Writes the given text to a new file. Example: File.WriteString(File.DirRootExternal, "1.txt", "Some text")

method.name: ReadMap2
method.comment: Similar to ReadMap. ReadMap2 adds the items to the given Map. By using ReadMap2 with a populated map you can force the items order as needed. Example: Dim m As Map m.Initialize m.Put("Item #1", "") m.Put("Item #2", "") m = File.ReadMap2(File.DirInternal, "settings.txt", m)

method.name: Size
method.comment: Returns the size in bytes of the specified file. This method does not support files in the assets folder.

property.name: DirDefaultExternal
property.comment: Returns the application default external folder which is based on the package name. The folder is created if needed.

property.name: DirInternalCache
property.comment: Returns the folder in the device internal storage that is used to save application cache data. This data will be deleted automatically when the device runs low on storage.

property.name: DirRootExternal
property.comment: Returns the root folder of the external storage media.

property.name: ExternalWritable
property.comment: Tests whether the external storage media can be written to (and also read from).

property.name: DirInternal
property.comment: Returns the folder in the device internal storage that is used to save application private data.

property.name: ExternalReadable
property.comment: Tests whether the external storage media can be read from.

property.name: DirAssets
property.comment: Returns a reference to the files added to the Files tab. These files are read-only.

class.name: anywheresoftware.b4a.objects.streams.File.InputStreamWrapper
class.comment: A stream that you can read from. Usually you will pass the stream to a "higher level" object like TextReader that will handle the reading. You can use File.OpenInput to get a file input stream.

method.name: Close
method.comment: Closes the stream.

method.name: BytesAvailable
method.comment: Returns an estimation of the number of bytes available without blocking.

method.name: ReadBytes
method.comment: Reads up to MaxCount bytes from the stream and writes it to the given Buffer. The first byte will be written at StartOffset. Returns the number of bytes actually read. Returns -1 if there are no more bytes to read. Otherwise returns at least one byte. Example: Dim buffer(1024) As byte count = InputStream1.ReadBytes(buffer, 0, buffer.length)

method.name: InitializeFromBytesArray
method.comment: Use File.OpenInput to get a file input stream. This method should be used to read data from a bytes array. Initializes the input stream and sets it to read from the specified bytes array. StartOffset - The first byte that will be read. MaxCount - Maximum number of bytes to read.

class.name: anywheresoftware.b4a.objects.streams.File.OutputStreamWrapper
class.comment: A stream that you can write to. Usually you will pass the stream to a "higher level" object like TextWriter which will handle the writing. Use File.OpenOutput to get a file output stream.

method.name: WriteBytes
method.comment: Writes the buffer to the stream. The first byte to be written is Buffer(StartOffset), and the last is Buffer(StartOffset + Length - 1).

method.name: Flush
method.comment: Flushes any buffered data.

method.name: Close
method.comment: Closes the stream.

method.name: ToBytesArray
method.comment: Returns a copy of the internal bytes array. Can only be used when the output stream was initialized with InitializeToBytesArray.

method.name: InitializeToBytesArray
method.comment: Use File.OpenOutput to get a file output stream. This method should be used to write data to a bytes array. StartSize - The starting size of the internal bytes array. The size will increase if needed.

class.name: anywheresoftware.b4a.objects.streams.File.TextWriterWrapper
class.comment:
Writes text to the underlying stream.
Example: Dim Writer As TextWriter Writer.Initialize(File.OpenOutput(File.DirDefaultExternal, "1.txt", False)) Writer.WriteLine("This is the first line.") Writer.WriteLine("This is the second line.") Writer.Close

method.name: Initialize
method.comment: Initializes this object by wrapping the given OutputStream using the UTF8 encoding.

method.name: Flush
method.comment: Flushes any buffered data.

method.name: WriteLine
method.comment: Writes the given Text to the stream followed by a new line character. Example: Dim Writer As TextWriter Writer.Initialize(File.OpenOutput(File.DirDefaultExternal, "1.txt", False)) Writer.WriteLine("This is the first line.") Writer.WriteLine("This is the second line.") Writer.Close

method.name: Close
method.comment: Closes the stream.

method.name: WriteList
method.comment: Writes each item in the list as a single line. Note that a value containing CRLF will be saved as two lines (which will return two item when read with ReadList). All values will be converted to strings.

method.name: Write
method.comment: Writes the given Text to the stream.

method.name: Initialize2
method.comment: Initializes this object by wrapping the given OutputStream using the specified encoding.

class.name: anywheresoftware.b4a.objects.streams.File.TextReaderWrapper
class.comment: Reads text from the underlying stream.

method.name: Initialize
method.comment: Initializes this object by wrapping the given InputStream using the UTF8 encoding.

method.name: Skip
method.comment: Skips the specified number of characters. Returns the actual number of characters that were skipped (which may be less than the specified value).

method.name: Ready
method.comment: Tests whether there is at least one character ready for reading without blocking.

method.name: ReadList
method.comment: Reads the remaining text and returns a List object filled with the lines. Closes the stream when done.

method.name: Close
method.comment: Closes the stream.

method.name: ReadLine
method.comment: Reads the next line from the stream. The new line characters are not returned. Returns Null if there are no more characters to read. Example: Dim Reader As TextReader Reader.Initialize(File.OpenInput(File.InternalDir, "1.txt")) Dim line As String line = Reader.ReadLine Do While line <> Null Log(line) line = Reader.ReadLine Loop Reader.Close

method.name: ReadAll
method.comment: Reads all of the remaining text and closes the stream.

method.name: Read
method.comment: Reads characters from the stream and into the Buffer. Reads up to Length characters and puts them in the Buffer starting as StartOffset. Returns the actual number of characters read from the stream. Returns -1 if there are no more characters available.

method.name: Initialize2
method.comment: Initializes this object by wrapping the given InputStream using the specified encoding.
